newsitem.title: SWEDEN: SAS adds 8-10 tonnes cargo space to Beijing, Delhi.
newsitem.headline: SAS adds 8-10 tonnes cargo space to Beijing, Delhi.

text.p: Scandinavian airline SAS said on Thursday increased frequencies on its flights to Beijing and Delhi would mean eight to 10 tonnes of cargo capacity on each leg of the new flights.
SAS said it would increase its flights to Beijing to five times weekly from four beginning September 19 and flights to Delhi to four frequencies per week from three.
"That will mean between eight and 10 tonnes for each destination for us on the cargo side in each direction," Jan Hagen, head of SAS Cargo in Denmark, told Reuters.
The airline was responding to market demand for cargo capacity, especially to Beijing.
"The market has been asking us over the past few years to increase capacity to the Far East," Hagen said.
"We are in advance of demand but we see the opportunity for utilising the space," he said.
"Usually when you create more frequencies you create more cargo," Hagen added.
